pull.title: Add BIPâ€¯349: OP_INTERNALKEY
pull.body: OP_INTERNALKEY is a new BIP342 tapscript only opcode (upgraded using OP_SUCCESS semantics) that takes bytes 1-32 (0-index, inclusive) from the BIP341 taproot control block and places them on the stack. This BIP describes that behavior.

events.body: Has this proposal been discussed on the mailing list?
This seems close to ready for a merge, although I am wondering whether it has gotten enough review from the community. I noticed that both this PR and the mailing list thread were not that active.
So what exactly needs to be done to get this BIP unstuck?
There do seem to be several unaddressed review comments. Happy to review again when the open review comments have been addressed.
Letâ€™s call this **BIPâ€¯349**. Could you please rename the file, add the number to the preamble, and update the README table accordingly?
CI isnâ€™t passing, I think the problem are two little issues with the Preamble.

BIP349: Set Created header to number assignment

events.message: BIP349: Set Created header to number assignment

events.body:
I updated the Preamble formatting:

- Move authors to separate lines
- Use `<pre>` formatting
- Correct the background color in README table
- Updated the "Created" header to use the date of the number assignment as prescribed by BIPâ€¯2.

This should now be good to go unless you wanted to make more changes before it is merged.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,70 @@ +
+  BIP: TBD
+  Layer: Consensus (soft fork)
+  Title: INTERNALKEY
+  Author: Brandon Black 
+  Comments-Summary: No comments yet.
+  Status: Draft
+  Type: Standards Track
+  Created: 2023-12-22
+  License: PD
+
+ +==Abstract== + +This BIP describes a new tapscript opcode (OP_INTERNALKEY) which +pushes the taproot internal key to the stack. + +==Specification== + +When verifying taproot script spends having leaf version 0xc0 (as defined in +BIP342), OP_INTERNALKEY replaces OP_SUCCESS203 +(0xcb). OP_INTERNALKEY pushes the taproot internal key, as defined +in BIP341, to the stack. + +==Motivation== + +===Key spend with additional conditions=== + +When building taproot outputs, especially those secured by an aggregate key +representing more than 1 signer; the parties may wish to collaborate on signing +with the taproot internal key, but only with additional script restrictions. In
comments.body: Can you give an example where using the key path with an aggregate key and having every participant enforce the additional restrictions themselves (i.e. only signing if they're met) wouldn't suffice?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,70 @@ +
+  BIP: TBD
+  Layer: Consensus (soft fork)
+  Title: INTERNALKEY
+  Author: Brandon Black 
+  Comments-Summary: No comments yet.
+  Status: Draft
+  Type: Standards Track
+  Created: 2023-12-22
+  License: PD
+
+ +==Abstract== + +This BIP describes a new tapscript opcode (OP_INTERNALKEY) which +pushes the taproot internal key to the stack. + +==Specification== + +When verifying taproot script spends having leaf version 0xc0 (as defined in +BIP342), OP_INTERNALKEY replaces OP_SUCCESS203 +(0xcb). OP_INTERNALKEY pushes the taproot internal key, as defined +in BIP341, to the stack. + +==Motivation== + +===Key spend with additional conditions=== + +When building taproot outputs, especially those secured by an aggregate key +representing more than 1 signer; the parties may wish to collaborate on signing +with the taproot internal key, but only with additional script restrictions. In +this case, OP_INTERNALKEY saves 32 bytes of witness space. + +===Mitigated control block overhead for scripts using hash locks=== + +In cases where script path spending is not desired, the internal key may be set +to a NUMS point whose bytes would otherwise be required in a tapscript. This +could be used with any hash locked transaction, for example, to save 32 witness +bytes.
comments.body: The internal key needs to correspond to a point on the secp256k1 curve, so how can this be used with "any hash locked transaction"?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,70 @@ +
+  BIP: TBD
+  Layer: Consensus (soft fork)
+  Title: INTERNALKEY
+  Author: Brandon Black 
+  Comments-Summary: No comments yet.
+  Status: Draft
+  Type: Standards Track
+  Created: 2023-12-22
+  License: PD
+
+ +==Abstract== + +This BIP describes a new tapscript opcode (OP_INTERNALKEY) which +pushes the taproot internal key to the stack. + +==Specification== + +When verifying taproot script spends having leaf version 0xc0 (as defined in +BIP342), OP_INTERNALKEY replaces OP_SUCCESS203 +(0xcb). OP_INTERNALKEY pushes the taproot internal key, as defined +in BIP341, to the stack. + +==Motivation== + +===Key spend with additional conditions=== + +When building taproot outputs, especially those secured by an aggregate key +representing more than 1 signer; the parties may wish to collaborate on signing +with the taproot internal key, but only with additional script restrictions. In +this case, OP_INTERNALKEY saves 32 bytes of witness space. + +===Mitigated control block overhead for scripts using hash locks=== + +In cases where script path spending is not desired, the internal key may be set +to a NUMS point whose bytes would otherwise be required in a tapscript. This +could be used with any hash locked transaction, for example, to save 32 witness +bytes.
comments.body: Yeah, I need to tighten up this language. In a typical case it will take about 2 tries to find a hash that is on the curve. For hash locks, a next preimage can be derived if the first does not hash to an X on the curve; for CTV locks, the template transaction can be modified in some slight protocol-compatible way to get a hash that is also an X on the curve.

comments.body: The most obvious case would be lightning symmetry where the parties want to pre-sign with CTV+CSFS to create a rebindable update transaction.

comments.body:
Please use the [preamble format](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0002.mediawiki#bip-header-preamble) specified in BIP2.

Instead of "BIP-XXXX" there should be a "BIP" header. The "Title" header is missing, the "Comments-URI" header is missing, and "Discussion" should be "Post-History".

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,68 @@
+| BIP-XXXX   | `OP_INTERNALKEY`
+| :--------- | :---------------
+| Layer      | Consensus (soft fork)
+| Author     | Brandon Black `<freedom@reardencode.com>`, Jeremy Rubin `<j@rubin.io>`
+| Discussion | https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/lnhance-bips-and-implementation/376/9
+| Status     | Draft
+| Type       | Standards Track
+| Created    | 2023-12-22
+| License    | BSD-3-Clause
+
+## Abstract
+
+This BIP describes a new tapscript opcode (`OP_INTERNALKEY`) which
+pushes the taproot internal key to the stack.
+
+## Specification
+
+When verifying taproot script spends having leaf version `0xc0` (as defined in
+[BIP 342]), `OP_INTERNALKEY` replaces `OP_SUCCESS203` (0xcb). `OP_INTERNALKEY`
+pushes the taproot internal key, as defined in [BIP 341], to the stack.
+
+## Motivation
comments.body: Additional useful feature: ability to inspect the tweak to a key (in combination with some OP_TWEAKVERIFY).

+
+## Specification

comments.body: nit: might be nice to mark "taproot internal key" as a formal term, either by italicizing, backticks or the like. I find that marking terms that invoke a suite of definitions and properties is really helpful. We do it a lot in the BOLTs and I'd recommend doing it in the BIPs as much as we can.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,70 @@
+```
+BIP: XXX
+Layer: Consensus (soft fork)
+Title: OP_INTERNALKEY
+Author: Brandon Black <freedom@reardencode.com>, Jeremy Rubin <j@rubin.io>
+Comments-URI: https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/wiki/Comments:BIP-XXXX
+Status: Draft
+Type: Standards Track
+Created: 2023-12-22
+License: BSD-3-Clause
+```
+
+## Abstract
+
+This BIP describes a new tapscript opcode (`OP_INTERNALKEY`) which
+pushes the taproot internal key to the stack.
+
+## Specification
+
+When verifying taproot script spends having leaf version `0xc0` (as defined in
+[BIP 342]), `OP_INTERNALKEY` replaces `OP_SUCCESS203` (0xcb). `OP_INTERNALKEY`
+pushes the taproot internal key, as defined in [BIP 341], to the stack.
+
+## Motivation
+
+### Key spend with additional conditions
+
+When building taproot outputs, especially those secured by an aggregate key
+representing more than one signer, the parties may wish to collaborate on
+signing with the taproot internal key, but only with additional script
+restrictions. In this case, `OP_INTERNALKEY` saves 8 vBytes.
comments.body: Perhaps you could elaborate how `OP_INTERNALKEY` would save 8â€¯vB, for example in a footnote. (I assume itâ€™s an x-only key of 32 bytes, and otherwise youâ€™d need a PUSH and the 32 bytes, but with `OP_INTERNALKEY` you only need only that one byte instead. But if I had to think about that, maybe others would also appreciate an explanation.

comments.body:
Did you mean:

```suggestion
In cases where key path spending is not desired, the internal key may be set
```

comments.body:
It seems to me that this should be perhaps a bit more specific what exactly is being pushed to the stack. I assume this is referring to 

> Let p = c[1:33] and let P = lift_x(int(p)) where lift_x and [:] are defined as in [BIP340](https://bips.xyz/0340#design). Fail if this point is not on the curve. [â€¦] q is referred to as taproot output key and p as taproot internal key.

but it would not hurt to clarify.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,70 @@
+```
+BIP: XXX
+Layer: Consensus (soft fork)
+Title: OP_INTERNALKEY
+Author: Brandon Black <freedom@reardencode.com>, Jeremy Rubin <j@rubin.io>
+Comments-URI: https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/wiki/Comments:BIP-XXXX
+Status: Draft

+```

+This BIP describes a new tapscript opcode (`OP_INTERNALKEY`) which
+pushes the taproot internal key to the stack.
+
+## Specification

+When verifying taproot script spends having leaf version `0xc0` (as defined in
+[BIP 342]), `OP_INTERNALKEY` replaces `OP_SUCCESS203` (0xcb). `OP_INTERNALKEY`

comments.body:
My point is that the "taproot internal key" refers to an abstract object in BIPâ€¯341 that is denoted as _p_:

> "q is referred to as taproot output key and p as taproot internal key."

and it wouldnâ€™t hurt to simply describe what you are referring to, instead of sending people to parse another BIP to get clued in.

How about:

> "pushes the 32-byte x-only representation _P_ of the taproot internal key _p_, as defined in [BIP 341], to the stack."

comments.body:
How about?
> When verifying taproot script path spends having leaf version `0xc0` (as defined in [BIP 342]), `OP_INTERNALKEY` replaces `OP_SUCCESS203` (0xcb). `OP_INTERNALKEY` pushes the 32-byte x-only representation (referred to as _P_) of the _taproot internal key_ (referred to as _p_), as defined in [BIP 341], to the stack.

comments.body: Note that BIP341 already defines the taproot internal key _p_ (note the lowercase) as a 32-byte array (as opposed to, say, a point on the secp256k1 curve), so it's not necessary to reinterpret it in any way before pushing it to the stack.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,70 @@
+```
+BIP: XXX
+Layer: Consensus (soft fork)
+Title: OP_INTERNALKEY
+Author: Brandon Black <freedom@reardencode.com>, Jeremy Rubin <j@rubin.io>
+Comments-URI: https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/wiki/Comments:BIP-XXXX
+Status: Draft
+Type: Standards Track

+License: BSD-3-Clause
+```

+## Abstract
+
+This BIP describes a new tapscript opcode (`OP_INTERNALKEY`) which
+pushes the taproot internal key to the stack.
+
+## Specification
+
+When verifying taproot script spends having leaf version `0xc0` (as defined in
+[BIP 342]), `OP_INTERNALKEY` replaces `OP_SUCCESS203` (0xcb). `OP_INTERNALKEY`
+pushes the taproot internal key, as defined in [BIP 341], to the stack.
comments.body:
Yes, we can add the "32-byte" qualifier for additional clarity. I would use slightly different phrasing, but that's just a suggestion:

> When verifying taproot script path spends having leaf version `0xc0` (as defined in [BIP 342]), `OP_INTERNALKEY` replaces `OP_SUCCESS203` (`0xcb`). `OP_INTERNALKEY` pushes the 32-byte _taproot internal key_ _p_, as defined in [BIP 341], to the stack.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,70 @@
+```
+BIP: XXX
+Layer: Consensus (soft fork)
+Title: OP_INTERNALKEY
+Author: Brandon Black <freedom@reardencode.com>, Jeremy Rubin <j@rubin.io>
+Comments-URI: https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/wiki/Comments:BIP-XXXX
+Status: Draft
+Type: Standards Track
+Created: 2023-12-22
+License: BSD-3-Clause
+```
+
+## Abstract
+
+This BIP describes a new tapscript opcode (`OP_INTERNALKEY`) which
+pushes the taproot internal key to the stack.
+
+## Specification
+
+When verifying taproot script spends having leaf version `0xc0` (as defined in
+[BIP 342]), `OP_INTERNALKEY` replaces `OP_SUCCESS203` (0xcb). `OP_INTERNALKEY`
+pushes the taproot internal key, as defined in [BIP 341], to the stack.
comments.body: I find it weird that both _taproot internal key_ and _p_ are in italic and together like that. No hard preference just feels off somehow!

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,70 @@
+```
+BIP: XXX
+Layer: Consensus (soft fork)
+Title: OP_INTERNALKEY
+Author: Brandon Black <freedom@reardencode.com>, Jeremy Rubin <j@rubin.io>
+Comments-URI: https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/wiki/Comments:BIP-XXXX
+Status: Draft
+Type: Standards Track
+Created: 2023-12-22
+License: BSD-3-Clause
+```
+
+## Abstract
+
+This BIP describes a new tapscript opcode (`OP_INTERNALKEY`) which
+pushes the taproot internal key to the stack.
+
+## Specification
+
+When verifying taproot script spends having leaf version `0xc0` (as defined in
+[BIP 342]), `OP_INTERNALKEY` replaces `OP_SUCCESS203` (0xcb). `OP_INTERNALKEY`
+pushes the taproot internal key, as defined in [BIP 341], to the stack.
comments.body: I understand that, but it's not unprecedented, for example in BIP341 you'll find "_annex_ _a_". Also notice that they're in separate italic blocks, even though you can't tell from the rendered version.
